p: The ability of the current climate models (1950–2000) to predict recently collected records ( n = 20, collected between 2001 and 2015) was moderate across all four model types (0.5 < p. s. < 0.75). However, the 2050 models—both MIROC-ESM and GISS-E2-R (NINT)—had much higher prediction success (0.8 < p. s. = 1). Further comparing the logistic output at each site under current and 2050 conditions showed that there was a significant increase in habitat suitability under future climate conditions (MIROC-ESM 2050: n = 20, W = 2, p < 0.001; GISS-E2-R (NINT) 2050: n = 20, W = 2, p < 0.001).
